intro: Aiphanes acanthophylla, commonly known as the spiny papyrus palm, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by triangular, fibrous fruits. It thrives in sandy or alluvial soils near the coast and is adapted to saline conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
